result.execSummary:
The defendant Malachi B. Tustison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample. Assessment/treatment all per agent.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Malachi B. Tustison in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Frank states matters are resolved today and states agreement.  State is in agreement and amoves to amend Ct 1 15CF219 to Misd. possession of THC.  Court grants amendment.  Atty Frank enters NC pleas.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  Atty Frank makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Probation for 12 months on each concurrent
